intro: Desmopsis microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited desmopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Desmopsis microcarpa is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions.
